name: 600.1 - Method Statement Development / Job Safety Analysis / Enviro Site Specific Plans
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior to Construction
Acceptance Criteria - Method Statement and JSEA Completed and signed by relevant authority
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior to Construction
Acceptance Criteria - DWG’s and Specifications are of For Construction and latest revision. Reviewed and approved by Designer and Client.
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior to Construction
Acceptance Criteria - Set out as per latest Design Model / For Construction Drawings.
Detail of Activity - Submit testing data fir the following materials: - AP65 -GAP 40 -GAP 20 -Hardfill
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior to Construction
Inspection / Test method - Quarry Testing Data
Acceptance Criteria - Material approvals to be sent to the Engineer. Refer Project Specs and Drawings;
○ Weathering Quality Index of A,AB, AC, BA, BB or CA
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior To Construction
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure underground services are positively identified and asbuilt. Where this interferes with design permanent works, Service provider and Designer to be notified immediately.
Acceptance Criteria - Finished Level – String Line, +0mm/-30mm (i.e. 30mm deep)
Comments - Remove to waste and excavate 530mm from top of kerb / 450mm from finished surface level.
Detail of Activity - Subgrade Quality / Soft Spots
Minimum Test Frequency - One per lot
Acceptance Criteria - Proof roll – Check for uniformity, soft areas to be undercut 200mm and backfilled with recycled pavement, AP40 Hardfill or AP65.
Minimum Test Frequency - Inferred CBR, 5 tests per 500m2. 1 per 20lm
Acceptance Criteria - Scala (bearing Strength on insitu subgrade) With the following requirement to be achieved;
600.9 - Full New Pavement - Undercuts/Subgrade Improvement Layer/Recycled Pavement Improvements
Acceptance Criteria - Subgrade undercut – String Line, each lane/area once undercut is complete.
600.10 - Full New Pavement - Undercuts/Subgrade Improvement Layer/Recycled Pavement Improvements

Comment - Use AP40 hard fill or recycled pavement if available. We propose to use proof roll and clegg testing instead of NDM testing because of the variablity of the recycled material and the bitumen content in it making it hard to test. This supersedes clause 22.2.1 in the project Specification.
600.11 - Full New Pavement - Undercuts/Subgrade Improvement Layer/Recycled Pavement Improvements
Acceptance Criteria - Subgrade undercut – String Line, each lane/area
600.13 - Pavement Over Existing / Stabilise Existing - Subbase Layer
Detail of Activity - Confirm Pavement Depth
Inspection / Test method - Test Pits / Visual Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Dig/core test pits to confirm if existing pavement ≥250mm deep.
• If sufficient depth, mill to 200mm from FL and continue with "Pavement Over Existing / Stabilise Existing - Subbase Layer" below.
• If insufficient, advise WSP Engineer, mill to 450mm from FL, and complete "Full New Pavement" requirements above
Comment - Existing pavement to measure 450mm from finished level (minimum).
600.14 - Pavement Over Existing / Stabilise Existing - Subbase Layer
Acceptance Criteria - Finished Level – String Line, +10mm/-30mm
600.15 - Pavement Over Existing / Stabilise Existing - Subbase Layer
Minimum Test Frequency - 20m centres, alternating wheel tracks where possible
Acceptance Criteria - Review beam test results to determine if undercuts are required.
Record documents - QC Sheets / Lab Result Sheet
Detail of Activity - MDD and OWC
Minimum Test Frequency - MDD and OWC 1 test per 5000m2 laid
Record documents - IANZ Accredited Lab Results
Detail of Activity - Mat Samples (1m2 canvas)
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 mat weighed every 400m2
Acceptance Criteria - Subbase to be stabalised with 3% cement.
• Keep record of tonnage of stabilisation agent (cement) used per area 14. kg/m2 +/- 0.5kg/m2.
Detail of Activity - Average usage test:
Minimum Test Frequency - Compare tonnes used (from delivery docket) with measured area
Inspection / Test method - Upon emptying the spreader/bulk tanker
Acceptance Criteria - Within +/- 2.5 % of the specified rate (3%)
Detail of Activity - Plateau Density Test
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 Plateau Density Test per lot (take samples from behind stabiliser as required - min 3 - for lab testing to determine moisture correction)

Acceptance Criteria - Determine minimum number of roller passes required to meet 95% MDD using both primary compaction and finishing compaction rollers. Report values. Used for moisture contect correction
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per lot
Inspection / Test method - Visual Inspection (with tape measure)
Detail of Activity - Indirect Tensile Strength (ITS)
Minimum Test Frequency - Two (2) soaked & two (2) dry ITS - taken by IANZ accredited lab technician behind hoe
Acceptance Criteria - Dry ITS > 500 Kpa, Soaked ITS >450 Kpa
Record documents - IANZ Accredited Lab Results
Detail of Activity - Stabilised Subbase Compaction
Minimum Test Frequency - Backscatter NDM (1 per 200m2)
Record documents - IANZ Accredited Lab Results
Detail of Activity - Stabilised Subbase Compaction
Minimum Test Frequency - Direct Transmission NDM (1 per 200m2)
Acceptance Criteria - Tests to be completed at 100mm depth increments starting at 200mm depth. Check for consistency/uniformity in test results.
Record documents - IANZ Accredited Lab Results
Minimum Test Frequency - Cores (1 per 2000m2, minimum 3 per lot)
Inspection / Test method - Core Visual Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Cohesivity (cores hold together to be removed)
• Grading of aggregate (i.e. good mix of different stone sizes)
Record documents - QC Sheets (Photos / Coring Report)
Detail of Activity - Indirect Tensile Strength (ITS)
Minimum Test Frequency - Cores (1 per 2000m2, minimum 3 per lot)
Acceptance Criteria - Target lab results. Tolerance: Lab result +/- 25%
Record documents - IANZ Accredited Lab Results
Acceptance Criteria - Layer Finished Level – String Line, each lane. Tolerance: +10mm/-30mm
Minimum Test Frequency - At completion of construction
Inspection / Test method - As-built to be submitted at the completion of construction
Acceptance Criteria - As-built to be submitted at the completion of construction
Information to be captured: Maintain Redline drawings through works.
Inspection / Test method - Info to be submitted by the completion of project construction
